about_the_game:
You're an AI that wakes up in an artificial world filled with puzzles that is there to train your cognitive abilities. There you meet an observer that directs you with snarky comments. The puzzles are set up to train your rope slinging (grappling gun) abilities. You start of with an 0% accuracy/complete status and have to build your skills up to a 100% to unlock the next challenge. You can expect fun and challenging physics puzzles where you need to use your grappling gun, and later your tethering gun, to manipulate your environment to get to the exit of each puzzle. You need to jump, swing, drag, throw, push, pull, and tether objects together in whatever ways necessary to achieve this. Expect challenges where you need to combine rope acrobatics with your puzzle solving abilities.

What you can expect:


  • Physics
  • Rope slinging acrobatics
  • Platforming action
  • Grappling gun based puzzles
  • Anti-gravity and many more physics driven twists
  • Robotic humor

reviews:
“you cannot play this game without thinking of Portal. From gameplay to setting, its influence is constantly felt throughout. However, by adopting a 2D playing field and several other unique choices, Entangled ensures it has its own identity”
LAUNCHPARTY

“due to the variety of the levels and how you make use of the grapple hook and rope, it's quite a unique experience and well worth taking a look at if you like puzzle games that add a bit of platforming into them. Very surprised by this one.”
GamingOnLinux
short_description: Entangled is a physics puzzle game revolving around grappling gun mechanics. You are immersed in a colorful environment while being entranced by a relaxing space ambient soundtrack. It is challenging, but extremely rewarding.
